intro: Bermudiana juncea var. brevispatha, commonly known as the Bermuda grass variant with short pathways, is a variant of Bermuda grass characterized by its compact growth habit and shorter leaf blades. It is native to the subtropical regions of the Americas and thrives in warm climates with well-drained soils. This variety is often used in turfgrass applications due to its high tolerance for heat and drought. Its dense growth pattern makes it effective for erosion control and groundcover. However, it requires regular maintenance to prevent excessive thatch buildup and maintain its aesthetic appeal.
